LongDescription: An emergency fire suppression system installed in general-purpose ammunition magazines, significantly reducing the probability of explosion due to fire.
FlavorText:
Most magazines have these already but they're not enough for most of the catastrophic fires. These actually spray a thick, smothering foam around the room that's surprisingly good at snuffing out fires. It's not foolproof, but Falke-Tethys knew what they were doing when they convinced the Naval Office to try it out in a real situation.

The foam breaks down into water after about a minute before drying up completely, but sometimes the foaming agent might not trigger and just results in complete liquefaction, spraying the whole magazine down in enough water to sink an Old World battleship.

- I. Parker, CMC
